melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, my mind is attached to the Naam, the Name of the Lord.

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. The emotions are conveyed in a direct and disciplined way. The balanced and focused character of this Raag is evident in its structure, in that its scale is restricted to ‘madh saptak’ (middle scale).

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: Asleep for so many incarnations, it is now awakened.

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. The emotions are conveyed in a direct and disciplined way. The balanced and focused character of this Raag is evident in its structure, in that its scale is restricted to ‘madh saptak’ (middle scale).

translation.text: I chant the Ambrosial Bani, the Glorious Praises of God.

translation.text: The Pure Teachings of the Perfect Guru have been revealed to me. ||1||

text: ਘਰਿ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਸੁਖ ਸਹਜ ਸਬਾਏ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Within my home, and outside as well, there is peace and poise all around. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: ghar bāhar sukh sahaj sabāē .1. rahāu .

text: ਹਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਕਥਾ ਸਦਾ ਜਪੁ ਜਪਨਾ ॥੨॥

translation.text: I continually chant and meditate on the Sermon of the Lord, Har, Har. ||2||

transliteration.text: har har kathā sadā jap japanā .2.

translation.text: are all in the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, the Support of the soul and the breath of life.
